discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer A: Architecture Governance is the practice and orientation by which Enterprise Architectures and other architectures are managed and controlled at an enterprise-wide level.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap44.html

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap44.html

Architecture Governance is the practice and orientation by which Enterprise Architectures and other architectures are managed and controlled at an enterprise-wide level.

Architecture Governance typically does not operate in isolation, but within a hierarchy of governance structures, which, particularly in the larger enterprise, can include all of the following as distinct domains with their own disciplines and processes:

Corporate Governance
Technology Governance
IT Governance
Architecture Governance
Each of these domains of governance may exist at multiple geographic levels - global, regional, and local - within the overall enterprise.

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is the practice by which the enterprise architecture and other architectures are managed and controlled at an enterprise level?
Which of the following reasons best describes why the ADM numbering scheme for versioning output is an example and not mandatory?

discussion.content:
Answer should be "A"

The TOGAF standard defines a number of input and output deliverables for each ADM phase
– These are suggestions and need not be followed exactly
– Output of an early phase may be modified in a later phase
– Version numbers are used to manage the output

A convention is used to illustrate the evolution of deliverables
o 0.1 – a high level outline deliverable
o 1.0 – a formally reviewed detailed deliverable

Selected Answer: B
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap04.html
'the ADM numbering scheme is provided as an example. It should be adapted by the architect to meet the requirements of the organization and to work with the architecture tools and repositories employed by the organization.'

Selected Answer: B
versioning is an example of how to be adaptable

Answer is B
Here is a quote from the TOGAF documentation that supports the answer:

"The ADM numbering scheme is provided as an example. It should be adapted by the architect to meet the requirements of the organization and to work with the architecture tools and repositories employed by the organization."

(Source: TOGAF 9.2 Part II: Architecture Development Method: https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap04.html#:~:text=Note%20that%20output%20is%20generated,how%20this%20convention%20is%20used.)

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer: B
From the book
The numbering scheme provided in the TOGAF ADM for its outputs is intended as an example. It should be adapted by the architect to meet the requirements of the organization and to work with the architecture tools and repositories employed by the organization

Option A is the correct answer.

By providing the versioning example as a guideline rather than a strict requirement, organizations can choose to adopt the suggested approach or adapt it to align with their existing practices.

Selected Answer: B
The purpose is to show illustrate the evolution of deliverables but the reason it is mandatory is for the ADM numbering scheme to be adapted by the architect to meet the requirements of the organization and to work with the architecture tools and repositories employed by the organization.

Selected Answer: A
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap04.html
"In particular, a version numbering convention is used within the ADM to illustrate the evolution of Baseline and Target Architecture Definitions"
B is the Correct Answer

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/index.html
==> It should be adapted by the architect to meet the requirements of the organization and to work with the architecture tools and repositories employed by the organization.

choices.C: To enable use with the Architecture Content Framework
choices.A: To show the evolution of deliverables

questions.question_text: Which one of the following does TOGAF Part VII recommend in order to implement an Enterprise Architecture Capability?

discussion.content: Part VI not VII !!!

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap40.html

As with any business capability, the establishment of an Enterprise Architecture Capability can be supported by the TOGAF Architecture Development Method (ADM). Successful use of the ADM will provide a customer-focused, value-adding, and sustainable architecture practice that enables the business, helps maximize the value of investments, and pro-actively identifies opportunities to gain business benefits and manage risk.

Establishing a sustainable architecture practice within an organization can be achieved by adhering to the same approach that is used to establish any other capability - such as a Business Process Management (BPM) capability - within an organization. 

The ADM is an ideal method to be used to architect and govern the implementation of such a capability. 

Applying the ADM with the specific Architecture Vision to establish an architecture practice within the organization would achieve this objective.

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D.
It is in Part VII for TOGAF9.1 while it moves to Part VI in TOGAF9.2.

For TOGAF9.1
Quote: "As with any business capability, the establishment of an enterprise Architecture Capability can be supported by the TOGAF Architecture Development Method (ADM)"
Ref: https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf91-doc/arch/chap46.html

For TOGAF9.2
Quote: "As with any business capability, the establishment of an Enterprise Architecture Capability can be supported by the TOGAF Architecture Development Method (ADM)."
Ref: https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf92-doc/arch/
Part II not VII
TOGAF 9.2 has only six parts. There were seven parts in TOGAF 9.1.

Selected Answer: B
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf92-doc/arch/chap42.html#tag_42_03

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap42.html

Ensuring the compliance of individual projects with the Enterprise Architecture is an essential aspect of Architecture Governance (see 44. Architecture Governance). To this end, the IT governance function within an enterprise will normally define two complementary processes:

The "Architecture function" will be required to prepare a series of Project Architectures; i.e., project-specific views of the Enterprise Architecture that illustrate how the Enterprise Architecture impacts on the major projects within the organization (see ADM Phases A to F).
The "IT Governance function" will define a formal Architecture Compliance review process (see 42.3 Architecture Compliance Reviews) for reviewing the compliance of projects to the Enterprise Architecture.

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap44.html

1. Implementing a system of controls over the creation and monitoring of all architectural components and activities, to ensure the effective introduction, implementation, and evolution of architectures within the organization.
2. Implementing a system to ensure compliance with internal and external standards and regulatory obligations.
3. Establishing processes that support effective management of the above processes within agreed parameters.
4. Developing practices that ensure accountability to a clearly identified stakeholder community, both inside and outside the organization.

questions.question_text: Which one of the following is an essential aspect of architecture governance?

choices.C: Controlling the implementation and deployment organizations
choices.B: Ensuring the compliance of individual projects to the enterprise architecture
choices.D: Authoring the Communications Plan for a given architecture project

choices.C: To evaluate the readiness of the organization to undergo change
choices.B: To communicate the technical readiness of the project
choices.D: To produce a new Request for Architecture Work
choices.A: To define the capabilities of the organization

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct: Communicate to management the status of technical readiness of the project

Source: https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap42.html

B is Correct choice.

42.3 Architecture Compliance Reviews
An Architecture Compliance review is a scrutiny of the compliance of a specific project against
established architectural criteria, spirit, and business objectives. A formal process for such
reviews normally forms the core of an Enterprise Architecture Compliance strategy.
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf92-doc/arch/chap42.html#tag_42_03

https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap42.html

An Architecture Compliance review is a scrutiny of the compliance of a specific project against established architectural criteria, spirit, and business objectives. A formal process for such reviews normally forms the core of an Enterprise Architecture Compliance strategy.

Usually is performed via various Architecture Compliance Review Checklists.

B is correct. 
http://www.opengroup.org/public/arch/p4/comp/comp.htm#:~:text=The%20goals%20of%20an%20architecture,or%20all%20of%20the%20following%3A&text=Document%20strategies%20for%20collaboration%2C%20resource,of%20the%20project%20to%20management

questions.question_text: Which one of the following describes a purpose of an Architecture Compliance review?
